TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void OpenReadCompletedEventHandler(object sender, OpenReadCompletedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed OpenReadCompletedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a OpenReadCompletedEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates downloading a resource for reading.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#30](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.openreadcom_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#30](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.openreadcom_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#30](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.openreadcom_0_1.vb)]
The following method is called when the download completes.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#31](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.openreadcom_0_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#31](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.openreadcom_0_2.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#31](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.openreadcom_0_2.vb)]
